The LPP design `` neural exercise '' reduce auditory hypersensitivity , improve auditory processing speech , improve behavioral state regulation . These improvement translate increase feeling safety calmness , thereby promote improvement social behavior . Participants : 30 participant , male female age 7-55 year , recruit study . Participants patient ADD Centre Biofeedback Institute Toronto . Procedures : Participants divide 1 2 group ( 1:1 ratio ) . Both group pre-intervention assessment # 2 , intervention , 1 week post intervention assessment 1 month post intervention assessment . Group 2 additional pre-intervention assessment session # 1 ( 1 week previous pre-intervention assessment # 2 ) ass stability measure prior start intervention . Pre- , post- , 1 month followup assessment include parent and/or self-report questionnaire , measure individual 's auditory processing ( `` SCAN '' ) , affect recognition ( `` DARE '' Dynamic Affect Recognition Evaluation ) , heart rate , prosody , `` RSA '' respiratory sinus arrhythmia ( derive non-invasive ECG recording ) , middle ear transfer function ( `` MESAS '' - Middle Ear Sound Absorption System ) .
